title: Sheet 7F
publication_title: James Ensor: The Temptation of Saint Anthony
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section body" id="body">On half of this sheet, Saint Anthony’s robe and a large fish extend from sheet 7E. At center appears a spiky, round, blue-tinged blowfish whose anthropomorphized face has tubular eyes and a downturned mouth. Below this sea creature are other human-crustacean-fish amalgams that allude to a primordial world evocative of Darwinian ideas about evolution, including a man with gill-like slits and a double-headed crab-lobster hybrid that continues into folio 7G/H. In the lower right corner, a spotted, amphibian-like creature reaches its webbed hand to touch Saint Anthony as it licks his robe with its long tongue. At upper right, blood from the boar in folio 6F/G flows onto the recumbent body of a naked woman. An artist’s patch formerly covered the woman entirely, and watercolor additions applied to the patch transformed the figure into an open fish mouth. SMC/KJN

</section><section id="figures">Sheet 7F. Interactive image.

fig. 2 </section>
